node.title: Warning as government announces new biodiversity trading platform
node.alt: Cattle in a shelter belt on farm with some riders
node.description: Farmers will earn income for improving the biodiversity on farm but scientists and community groups warn that too much land may be lost to productive agriculture.
node.content:
["Farmers will earn income for improving the\u00a0biodiversity on-farm, under the\u00a0Australian government's National Stewardship Trading Platform, but scientists and community groups are warning that too much land may be lost to productive agriculture.", "The Australian National University (ANU) will manage a pilot scheme as part of the government's Agriculture Stewardship Package.", "Professor Andrew Macintosh said farmers would be able to plant trees and get carbon credits for 25 years, but they will also get an up-front payment if they meet some conditions.", "\"If you plant particular trees, you'll get a biodiversity payment upfront\u00a0for three years, and from years four onward, you'll hopefully be able to earn those carbon credits and sell them.\"\u00a0", "
Major new source of income
", "", "
Farmers will be paid up-front for three years under a government pilot biodiversity scheme and then could earn money from carbon credits.(Supplied: Carbon Farming Institute)
", "The scheme has\u00a0Queensland farmer James Henderson excited about the potential income for farmers for\u00a0ecosystem services.", "\"The CSIRO says it is going to be worth $48b by 2050,\" he said.", "\"So, that's bigger than the beef industry now, and\u00a0the groundwork, the rules, the companies that are emerging. That's all happening now.\"", "The federal government has funded a second round of projects that will establish trials in six regions:", "
Australia leading the world in biodiversity trading
", "Federal agriculture minister David Littleproud said this potential new income stream for farmers through the trading platform.", "\"We're creating a brand that they can put on their beef, on their sheep, on their wool, and there will be a biodiversity seal that will be internationally recognised.\"", "
Too much land getting locked up
", "", "
Lilly Hand is deeply concerned about the rise of carbon farming in the far west of NSW.(Supplied:)
", "Not everyone is excited about the idea of yet another scheme that could lock up farming land.\u00a0", "Bourke resident Lilly Hand is deeply concerned about the future of her town.", "Her region in western NSW is a hotspot for carbon storage projects in Australia.", "She has been involved in the agricultural show movement as a young judge.", "After spending time away at boarding school, she was disheartened to see so many farming families had left the district when she returned.", "\"There's no-one to run the properties, no people and no stock and people have given up,\u00a0families are like, what's the point of living here?\"", "Professor Richard Eckard, who oversees Australia's carbon accreditation programs, said some measures were needed to prevent \"perverse outcomes\" from net zero policies.", "\"Taking viable farmland and putting it down to trees \u2026 or locking up productive farmland so it can store more carbon in the soil are examples of perverse outcomes,\" he said.", "\u00a0\"The moment you put a monetary value on carbon in trees and soils you've created an incentive for a broker in the middle to create a business model out of it.\"", "
Regulations to restrict tree planting
", "Mr Littleproud announced last week some proposals to stop properties larger than 15 hectares from being locked up for carbon farming.\u00a0", "\"If it is more than 33 per cent of that individual property, they will have to apply to the federal government and the minister for agriculture will have the veto powers to decline that application if they believe it is not in the interests of the community.\"", "He wants to stop the loss of people and productive agriculture from areas like the Paroo in Queensland and Bourke and Cobar in western New South Wales.\u00a0", "The veto power would only apply to new or expanded native forest regeneration projects that make up more than a third of the farm and are larger than 15 hectares in area.", "The consultation period on the proposed changes will close on\u00a0January 14, 2022."]
